A tough skin is necessary, as it can be fairly easy for either side to take the competitive nature too far and play as though Karma is out on holiday.  But when you get a good group of humans together and you play like a team, it can be some of the most rewarding gameplay out there.  Great for fans of horror that want to be just a little too close to your movie icons for comfort. Though, to be fair, the original characters have rightfully earned a large fanbase.

To be successful, you have to use each day as an opportunity to improve, to be better, to get a little bit closer to your goals. It might sound like a lot of work—and with a busy schedule, next to impossible. But the best part is, the more you accomplish, the more you’ll want to do, the higher you’ll want to reach. So as long as you have the hunger for success, you will always have the power within you to achieve it

At it's best, it's like hide and seek on steroids. Spooky nightmare steroids.  Game-play that is a blend of stealth, tactics and mechanical skill that create an engaging back-and-forth between killer and survivors. The result is an engaging experience where each side is trying to both physically and strategically outmaneuver the other. 

Unfortunately the game is very often _not_ at its best. Matchmaking can take forever and often can be atrociously unbalanced.  Disconnects are barely penalized so rage-quits are common, which hurts the survivors chances tremendously. (Or just flat out ends a match if the killer leaves). Hitboxes can range from questionable to outright broken at times.  I could go on. The game has it's issues. 

Still, for all it's faults, of which there are many, I've never played anything quite like Dead by Daylight.  It's great fun, and the devs are actively working to improve the game. But for now, prepare to put up with some bullshit,

Bueno, ya llevo 60 horas en este juego y es muy bueno, sacando de lado que si sos survivor el killer te tunelee o campee es muy bueno, el aprendizaje parece facil pero no lo es y la cooperación es algo importante así que jugar con amigos es ideal. Jugar de killer es entretenido pero tambien es complicado de llevar al principio. Yo digo que si son varios amigos los que vayan a jugar pueden comprarselo tranquilamente. Muy recomendado.

There's a major learning curve to using the windows and pallets to escape killers and to mind gaming/looping killers but definitely worth playing!

The game is very fun, especially with friends. You can play with friends, kill your friends, and just go straight to into solos. If you like chilling out, this is the game for you, and this game also has a (very light) competitive side too which is nice.

I love this game, But it is pretty obvious that sometimes the devs do not listen to the player base what so ever. Recently this has changed. But for the time being, i would rather them implement more game features than a new killer survivor duo. Some games i play i think the game is no longer a broken hot piece of garbage, But then the next game i get suck in a fucking rock or matched against someone way better or way worse than me. The MMR system was hot garbage, Not even close to confident. Overall I do not recommend you buy it until its fixed or the devs pay attention more but its tough for me to say this because its obviously one of my favorite games.
